text: The list of EuroCup-winning head coaches shows all of the head coaches that have won the EuroLeague championship. The EuroCup is the European-wide 2nd- tier level men's professional basketball club competition. The competition was founded under the name the ULEB Cup. == Key == {| class="wikitable" |- |style="background-color:#FFE6BD; width:6em"| |Elected into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame as a coach |- |style="background- color:#ddffdd; width:6em"|* |Elected into the FIBA Hall of Fame |- | style="background-color:#FFD700; border:1px solid #aaaaaa; width:6em"|* |Member of both the FIBA Hall of Fame and the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. |} == List == {| class="wikitable" !Season ! style="width:200px| Head Coach ! style="width:223px| Winning team ! Ref. |- |2002–03 | Paco Olmos | Pamesa Valencia | |- |2003–04 | Sharon Drucker | Hapoel Jerusalem | |- |2004–05 | Tomo Mahorič | Lietuvos rytas | |- |2005–06 |bgcolor="#ddffdd"| Dušan Ivković* | Dynamo Moscow | |- |2006–07 | Joan Plaza | Real Madrid | |- |2007–08 | Aíto García Reneses | DKV Joventut | |- |2008–09 | Rimas Kurtinaitis | Lietuvos rytas | |- |2009–10 | Neven Spahija | Power Electronics Valencia | |- |2010–11 | Evgeniy Pashutin | UNICS | |- |2011–12 | Rimas Kurtinaitis | Khimki | |- |2012–13 | Evgeniy Pashutin | Lokomotiv Kuban | |- |2013–14 | Velimir Perasović | Valencia Basket | |- |2014–15 | Rimas Kurtinaitis | Khimki | |- |2015–16 | Ergin Ataman | Galatasaray Odeabank | |- |2016–17 | Joan Plaza | Unicaja | |- |2017–18 | David Blatt | Darüşşafaka | |- |2018–19 | Jaume Ponsarnau | Valencia Basket | |- |- |} == Multiple winners == {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:40px |Number !! style="width:200px | Head Coach !! style="width:370px| Winning team(s) !! style="width:50px|First !! style="width:50px|Last |- | 3|| Rimas Kurtinaitis || Lietuvos rytas, Khimki (2) ||2009 ||2015 |- | rowspan=2|2|| Joan Plaza || Real Madrid, Unicaja || 2007 || 2017 |- | Evgeniy Pashutin || UNICS, Lokomotiv Kuban || 2011 || 2013 |- |} == See also == * EuroCup Basketball Coach of the Year * List of EuroLeague-winning head coaches ==References== Coaches
title: List of EuroCup-winning head coaches
